newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dresdner to report 1997 profit by segment.
newsitem.headline: Dresdner to report 1997 profit by segment.

text.p: Germany's Dresdner Bank AG said on Friday it would follow other banks' lead by reporting 1997 earnings according to its different business segments for the first time ever.
Chairman Juergen Sarrazin made this pledge at the bank's annual general meeting.

Sarrazin also said that Dresdner's operating profit from its foreign investment banking units in 1996 was 400 million marks. A figure for investment banking business overall, counting German business, was not yet available.
Dresdner reported operating profit of 2.86 billion marks for 1996.
